message.content:
{"id": "35156", 
"title": "Ctrl+F1 does not work on some fields in the help search", 
"description": "", 
"OB": "Ctrl+F1 does not work on some fields in the help search", 
"EB": "OS: Linux GTK
Build: RC2 with IBM Java 2131 JRE
Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch Eclipse with DBCS locale.
2. Select 'Search Help' from the menu bar.
3. When the window pops up, click on the first text field and press ctrl+F1.

Expected Result:
A help pop-up screen should appear, displaying information about the Help Search.

Actual Result:
Nothing happens.

Comments:
1. This issue occurs on all DBCS languages.
2. The issue only occurs in the first text field. When cycling through all the other fields using the tab key, ctrl+F1 functions properly by displaying the correct text.
3. Please refer to the attached screenshot, which highlights the field that is not responding to ctrl+F1 (circled in red). The fields circled in green work properly.", 
"SR": ""}

origin.input_prompt:

In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:

<BUG REPORT>

', 'SR': ''}
